item.title: Chapter 3 - System Component Overview
item.description: This article is Chapter 3 in the CompTIA A+ certification course on Alison.com that teaches a System Component Overview of computers. Processors and CPUs Processors and the Operating systems are the Work horse of the computer. • Processors and CPUs Brains in the computer Allow it to perform many tasks really fast Processor performs calculations based on request from Operating System, which controls acess to system memory • Processing speeds

item.title: What is the CompTIA A+ Certification?
item.description: This article describes the CompTIA A+ certification. What is the CompTIA A+ certification? According to https://www.comptia.org/, “CompTIA A+ is the industry standard for establishing a career in IT”. The whole point of the certification is to teach new IT trainees how to be problem solvers so they can tackle issues relating to core technologies from security to networking to virtualization and more. CompTIA A+ certification is considered the only IT industry-recognized credential with “performance testing” that proves the professionals can think on their feet when performing critical IT support tasks.
